data.name: Alaskan Amber
data.description: Alt. The name of this beer style comes from the German word "alt" meaning "old". This refers to the aging that alts undergo since they ferment more slowly and at colder temperatures than most ales. Slow fermentation helps condition the flavors in Alaskan Amber, contributing to its overall balance and smoothness.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: Alaskan Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Alaska has a rich history of brewing. From the explorers of the 1700s through the Gold Rush, many a thirsty Alaskan has been able to enjoy locally made beers.

In 1986, 28-year-olds Marcy and Geoff Larson reignited that tradition when they opened the Alaskan Brewing Company, the 67th brewery in the country and the first brewery in Juneau since Prohibition. Alaskan beers reflect many of the same characteristics of beers that were brewed here during the gold rush era. From the historically based Alaskan Amber recipe to alder-smoked malts and Sitka spruce tips, Alaskan beers reflect Juneau's local brewing history and innovation.

Marcy and Geoff were drawn to the beauty and adventure of Alaska, but finding a livelihood that would allow them to stay was a challenge. "Why not start a brewery?" a friend suggested. Other than the extreme financial and logistical challenges of brewing beer in the Last Frontier, they couldn't think of why not.

Maybe the idea wasn't so far-fetched. After all, Geoff was a chemical engineer and a homebrewer and was married to Marcy, an adventure-seeking accountant and aspiring bush pilot. Together they brought a unique skill set to the task of opening a brewery in Alaska.

While researching brewing in Alaska, Marcy unearthed shipping records from Douglas City Brewing Co. (1899-1907) that listed ingredients for its popular beers and a newspaper article that described the way it was brewed. Geoff homebrewed a batch of the Gold Rush-era brew and they could see what made it so popular. That beer is now known as Alaskan Amber.

In December 1986, Alaskan Brewing Co. officially began operations when Geoff, Marcy and 10 volunteers spent 12 hours hand packaging the first 253 cases of Alaskan Amber for distribution in Juneau, Alaska. From that very humble beginning, Alaskan Brewing Co. has grown to become the most award-winning craft brewery in the history of the Great American Beer Festival and expanded distribution to 14 states.

data.name: Ale Camino Amber Ale
data.description: Ale Camino is an American style Amber Ale hand-crafted with a blend of malt and hops, which give it a truly unique character. The aroma blends sweet malts, a hint of chocolate, and a light earthy nose that highlights the malty aromatics. Ale Camino has a round and full-bodied flavor, full of sweet malts, chocolate malts, crystal malts, and hop varieties Willamette and Zythos added for minimal bitterness and aroma, hand-crafted together for a rich, complex flavor and aroma. This amber finishes with a clean, semi dry and light hoppy finish.

breweries.name: Uinta Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Named after the only major east-west running mountain range located in the continental U.S., Uinta Brewing Company's journey began in 1993 with the reality that passion for craft beer and a hankering for the great outdoors could align in Salt Lake City, UT.
 
Built on an axis point that endorses sustainability, community involvement and innovation, their compass guides them on a path to admirable, consistent craft beer leading consumers to discover a brand with passion, personality and soul.  Precisely, GREAT BEER is Uinta's True North.

breweries.name: Adkin Brewery
breweries.description:
The Adkin Brewery was originally founded as a hobby in early 2000.  It is a true example of a small cottage brewery, and is run by the sole proprietor, Mr Shaun Cunningham, from the garage attached to his house on a housing estate in Wantage, Oxfordshire.  All of Shaun's beers are produced using only natural ingredients, most of which are supplied by Best Mates Brewery, Ardington and Ken Thomas of Arkwright's Homebrew in Highworth, near Swindon, Wiltshire www.arkwrightshomebrew.com.

At the moment, Shaun still has a full-time job.  Despite the restrictions placed upon Shaun in terms of both time and space, you can see from the photographs just how much can be achieved in a small, basic garage.  As for the quality of the products, well, that speaks for itself!

Located just outside Albuquerque, in Moriarty NM, our craft beer is brewed in the wild west and is out of this world! We are excited about our craft and excited to offer fellow beer enthusiasts the best in locally made flavors

breweries.name: Sierra Blanca Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Located in Moriarty, New Mexico and also known as Rio Grande Brewing Company. We currently brew during the year 10-12 of our own Brews. We now have a full 1/2 acre Beer Garden complete with horseshoes, bocci ball a couple of grills and pleanty of seating.

We  Bottle 17 different beers for distribution.

Ben Couger is the brewmaster and Rich Weber still brews as well.  With a total of 11 people including office staff we anticipate brewing about 9100 barrels this year. 

Our Brewery is open 6 days a week and always ready to offer up a cold pint or give a tour of our Brewery.

Come on by and see what may be brewing or being bottled. 

We also do contract brewing for Abbey Beverage, Premier Beverage (Isotopes Amber and Blonde), Guns & Oil Brewing and Rodeo Cold Brewing. 

Always a good time here at Sierra Blanca Brewing/ Rio Grande Brewing Company!!

data.name: All American Red Ale
data.description: A spirited blend of gently roasted malts and brisk Colorado water, our radiant amber ale bubbles with personality, while remaining mellow and approachable. Light notes of chocolate and caramel are enhanced by a subtle hop character presenting a wonderful balance to this easy drinking beer

data.name: All-In Amber
data.description: All-In Amber is a traditional English ordinary bitter.  This beer is low in alcohol so it can be consumed in quantity. A truly balanced beer, both hops and malt are evident in each sip.  This Amber ale is dry-hopped and employs an English yeast strain with slightly fruity notes. The alcohol content of All-In is 3.9%. All-In Amber  is a signature beer of Cory Buenning.

breweries.name: Snake River Brewing
breweries.description:
America's most award-winning small brewery since 1994 offering a wide array of lagers and ales with hand-crafted cuisine. Locals and tourists alike co-mingle in a friendly and casual environment.

Make yourself at home at Snake River Brewing in the heart of the Teton Mountain Range. All roads, trails, bike paths, climbing routes and ski runs lead to “The Brewpub”! After a day in the great outdoors how can you not partake of a tasty malt beverage and a delicious meal

data.name: Alley-Ooop!
data.description:
A smooth and easy drinking beer, sort of a cross between our Export and the Naughty Nurse. Very similar to an Octoberfest. It is sweet and carmel-like due to the use of German malt and hops, and an extended cold lagering, or aging, period.
Brewed for the 2015 AAC Basketball Tournament, which is being held at the XL Center March 12-15. Alley-oop is a football and basketball term that generally means a high arching pass. In basketball, another player (hopefully on the same team) catches the ball in mid air and dunks it into the basket. The name is said to derive from the French expression “Allez! Hop!” (Go! Jump!), which circus performers would yell just before taking off on the high wire trapeze.

breweries.name: Bull & Bush Pub & Brewery
breweries.description:
In 1971, casting aside their stockbroker careers to become the bellwether personalities of the Denver restaurant industry in the 70s and 80s, the brothers built the Bull & Bush to kick start a list of successful restaurants.

Last but certainly not least, the pub is now also a brewery. Since brewing its first batch on New Year’s Day of 1997, the Bull & Bush brewing operation has become world renowned for its great tasting and innovative creations. Master Brewer Gabe Moline’s brews have earned multiple accolades including the Best Beer in a Brewpub award in Westword‘s Best of Denver, multiple awards at the annual Denver-hosted Great American Beer Festival (GABF) and most recently the Bull and Bush’s “The Legend of the Liquid Brain Imperial Stout” was given the highest honor, a Gold award, at the World Beer Cup – the world’s largest commercial beer competition.

breweries.name: Lassen Ale Works
breweries.description: Northeast California's only brewpub-- Lassen Ale Works--  Located in uptown Susanville, CA at the historic Pioneer Saloon.  21 and over only, ID required. On-site brewery.  Six house beers on draft, plus seasonal specialties and guest taps.  Full bar offers good selection of wine by the glass and craft cocktails, single malt scotch and premium liquors. Fine pub fare is prepared in house, from scratch. House specialties include beer battered fish with hand cut chips, lamb dip and fresh salads. Weekend lunch and dinner specials. Pool tables.

breweries.name: Aloha Beer Company
breweries.description:
Aloha Beer Company embodies the classic Hawaii lifestyle. With the generous spirit of Aloha as a namesake, this is a premium beer that combines the smooth balance of ohana with the refreshing, hang-loose attitude of a Sunday barbecue. Every bottle of "Hawaii's Beer" is a heartfelt "wish you were here" message from the Islands of Aloha.

We can't create a Hawaiian sunrise, but we can brew the next best thing.

breweries.name: Mill House Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Mill House Brewing Company opened as a brewpub in November 2013, in the Historic Mill House that has, for many years, been a watering hole and restaurant for the citizens of Poughkeepsie and the surrounding areas. The rehabilitated 1820’s brick house is now home to a 7 Barrel single-infusion system, built by Portland Kettle Works, along side a restaurant that seats over 250+ guests. Mill House Brewing Company has long focused on creating Local Craft Beers, with World Class Flavor.  At MHBC, where art & science meet, it’s important to understand our humble beginnings. 
Jamie Bishop and Lawrence Stock, are Two best friends brewing better beer.  From the Days in the basement of Jamie’s Hudson Valley home, to brewing over 600 barrels in the first year at MHBC, the two have continually focused on creating beers that are not only seasonally varied, but have classic integrity. An American Brewers Guild graduate in 2014, Mill House Brewing Company continually strives to create better beer, with in-house lab testing, water recipes, and house yeast strain cultivation.  They are true masters of their craft, brewing 25 uniquely different beers to date, with many more on the way!
Mill House Brewing Company has enjoyed much success since 2013.  The Brewpub was awarded Top 100 Hot Spots in American from OpenTable dining, Hudson Valley Magazine Best New Restaurant and Bar Menu, Hudson River Craft Brew Fest “People’s Choice” in 2013/2014, as well as countless other accolades.  With the brewer owners, restaurateur partners Chris and Daniel Crocco, and boutique development firm RL Baxter Building, the team looks to spread their wings even more in 2015.  With a 20bbl brewhouse on the horizon this year, Mill House Brewing Company is dedicated to bringing Local Craft, and World Class Flavor to the world.  Prost!

data.name: Alpine Amber
data.description: This lightly hopped Ale has a beautiful deep amber hue and is rich in caramel malt flavor. Finishes clean to keep you coming back for more.

breweries.name: Ouray Brewery
breweries.description:
The Ouray Brewery is  open daily and offers seating on the only rooftop patio in the “Switzerland of America” — Ouray, Colorado. We also offer an intimate downstairs bar with 4 swings (you did read that right), a dining room on the mid-level of our pub and a mezzanine viewing area of our brew house.

We offer a full menu of juicy burgers,  fresh salads, apps and entrees. Try the Grilled Avocado Salad or our popular pulled pork sandwich.

Ouray has all the right ingredients — unspoiled scenery and water, a great local community and culture and close proximity to other great breweries. Come join us for a brew and a taste of all Ouray and Ouray Brewery have to offer.

style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale
style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.

breweries.name: Saint Arnold Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Saint Arnold Brewing Company, located in Houston, is Texas' Oldest Craft Brewery. Our goal is to brew world class beers and deliver them to our customers as fresh as possible making them the best beers in Texas and Louisiana. Our customers are beer lovers - people that appreciate great, full-flavored beers.

Our small crew does everything at the brewery: brew the beer, filter the beer, keg the beer, bottle the beer, sell the beer and drink the beer. For us, this is a passion, not a job. We believe that this comes through in the beers we make. Our beers have soul.

We brew several different beers; some are year round, some are seasonal and a few are single batch brews. They are available in bars, restaurants, grocery stores, liquor stores and warehouse stores throughout Texas and Louisiana.

Our first keg of beer was shipped on June 9, 1994. Founded by Brock Wagner and Kevin Bartol, we chose Houston because, other than living here, this was the largest city in the country that did not have a microbrewery. Brock was a longtime homebrewer and had considered opening a brewery as far back as college, although that was quickly dismissed as a silly idea. Seven years after graduating, Brock revisited the idea, enlisted Kevin's help and the brewery was off and running. Kevin has since left the business after a bitter battle. (Just kidding - but don't you wish people wrote that when it was the truth?).

Please visit us if you are in Houston. We have a public open house every weekday at 3:00 PM and every Saturday starting at 11:00 AM.

Cheers!

data.name: Altitude Amber Ale
data.description: A medium bodied ale, Altitude Amber is light amber in color with a medium caramel tone. Hops contribute a mild pine and citrus flavor.

breweries.name: Altitude Chophouse & Brewery
breweries.description:
Our brewery, which is nestled inside of our dining room walls, is primarily an ale producing brewery. Ninety five percent of all the beer we brew at Altitude is ale, including our award winning 7200’ Stout and Rosebud Strong Ale.

Our beer is brewed using single step and multi-step infusion mashing, which is patterned off the British brewing tradition.  All of our beer is made from four basic ingredients: malt, hops, yeast and water. Our recipes use American malts, hops from Europe and America, and yeast cultured from the traditional yeast stocks found throughout the world. We do not filter our beer.

We brew over 20 styles of beer throughout the year. We offer eight beers on tap year round and we pour up to three specialty beers at any given time.

We invite you to try Altitude’s microbrews and we hope you’ll like them as much as we do!

breweries.name: 14th Star Brewing
breweries.description:
History books tell us that local Vermonter and beer enthusiast Ethan Allen was a leader inthe effort to make Vermont the fourteenth star on the U.S. flag in 1791. And those textbooks are right; especially about the 1791 part.

Today, in Franklin County, Vermont, Army veteran Steve Gagner is honoring his home state and passion – brewing great beer – with 14th Star Brewing Co.

14th Star is Steve’s 1,200-square-foot nanobrewery on Lower Newton Street, in St. Albans City.

Nanobreweries make less than four-barrel batches, and as of your eyes hitting this paragraph, there are still less than 100 nanobreweries in America.

What makes 14th Star stand out? Well, it’s about the only brewery in Vermont that’s located above Burlington. Period.

But that’s not it. Not entirely.

You see – this is your beer. Oh, sure, Steve plans on starting you off with one-barrel batches of pale ale, brown ale, and Belgian white. There will be more, of course, but that’s up to you. So tell Steve what style beer you want in your 14th Star growler at: steve@14thstarbrewing.com.
On our end, we are readying to open our doors. Our goal is this July. (Check out our Pint of Progress on our home page.)

We can’t wait to watch you let your hair down and lift your glass, Vermont. We’ll enjoy that. And remember – this is your beer. You enjoy it.

breweries.name: Wonderland Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Wonderland Brewing Company is a new small batch brewery in Broomfield, Colorado, and our goal is to turn every frown upside down. Big dreams, a big property, and carefully crafted beers are our not-so-secret ingredients to do so. With 9,000-square-feet of space, 94 parking spots, and over an acre of outdoor fun, Wonderland Brewing Company offers a unique craft beer experience to beer-buffs of all sorts.

How can you get a unique craft beer experience at our brewery, you wonder? Hold a ping pong match on one of our six tournament-style ping pong tables that adorn our tasting room, burn those hard earned beer calories al fresco on our basketball courts, or simply take a seat in one of the largest tasting rooms around and enjoy a quality, hand-crafted brew. Thanks to our shocking space that's ideal for corporate outings, private parties, farmers markets, classic car shows, yoga classes, and more, Wonderland Brewing Company is an oasis for the community and beyond.

Enough bragging about our property, though. Wanna know why we chose to dive into the brewing industry?

Our passion for people, happiness, and the magic behind making beer inspires our team to bring the community together to celebrate life and cherish the ritual of beer. We truly treasure craft beer's gift of rallying friends and family, and we are excited for the opportunity to bring joy to beer-fanatics. Our head brewer values the art and science of brewing beer and has a philosophy entrenched in care for his creations, which will be discovered during every sip of our quality brews.

When you visit Wonderland, you'll find a creative crew that is committed to making you smile.

Please know that standards are set high for Wonderland Brewing Company in all aspects of our brewery.

data.description: Amber is eminently drinkable and well-balanced with notes of caramel sweetness; roasted malt and a slightly bitter finish from the late addition Cascades. The head on the beer is slightly off-white and laces down the glass throughout the drinking experience.

breweries.name: Dead Armadillo Brewery
breweries.description: At Dead Armadillo Craft Brewing we are committed to crafting fine beers that meet the highest standards of the industry. Our three flagship beers are an India Pale Ale (IPA), an Amber Ale, and a Wheat Beer. Our brewery was established in the Spring of 2012, the culmination of years of dreaming, drinking, hoping and planning. After all, what could be better than brewing beer for a living? It is an opportunity to spread the good cheer that comes with quality ales.

data.name: Amber
data.description: The perfect balance of bitter and aromatic. It’s our NW take on an Amber Ale: A bit cloudy with a big, bright hop presence. Pour it in a glass or drink it from the can. Pairs well with: food, concerts, parties, television, boating, yard work, avoiding yard work, badminton, etc.

breweries.name: Hilliard's Beer
breweries.description:
We opened our doors in October, 2011 with focus on beer in cans.  Founded by Ryan Hilliard and Adam Merkl, we now have a much larger crew and even more beer.

We self-distribute canned and draft beer to bars and restaurants within Seattle and have a 1 case minimum.  Please contact Adam Merkl at 206-915-3303 or adam@hilliardsbeer.com for info.  Off-premise sales within Seattle as well as on and off-premise sales of our canned beer outside Seattle is handled by our distributor, Noble.

breweries.name: Bad Jimmy's Brewery
breweries.description: In todays world to have great taste in beer you have to go to your craft brewers were beer is actually studied and time is taken to insure the quality and taste is always the same. Supporting your local breweries is a great way to keep wonderful, full flavor ale's and lagers available. Ballard, Wa. will soon be the home to Bad Jimmy's with a tap room for everyone to enjoy the full flavor ale's that we have to offer. Watch for us in your local bars and please let us know what you think of our tasty liquid joy.

breweries.name: 3 Freaks Brewery
breweries.description: The mission of 3 Freaks brewery is to offer small batch hand crafted beer that is truly flavorful. This will be provided to our craft beer family in a laid back atmosphere where we love to talk beer. And yes, you are part of the family. We are a humble brewery and don't have all the answers but we still love to talk beer.

breweries.name: Prime Microbrewery
breweries.description:
We are a family owned and run microbrewery. We simply love beer!! Always have, and always will. Our goal is to brew the best beer possible, using only natural ingredients and respecting the traditional art of brewing.
The beginning… Throughout our trips to Europe as a family, we have visited numerous Micros and specialized brewpubs and enjoyed amazing beer. When Cyprus joined the European Union in 2004 we were happy to see that many of the foreign beers we loved so much started being imported to the island!! Finally more quality and tasty beer options would be introduced to Cyprus.
Unfortunately as we soon found out something was terribly wrong…The beer we tasted and loved throughout Europe just didn’t taste the same…
Long sea transportation and storage time in hot conditions stripped a huge amount of the taste and character of the beer we longed to see in Cyprus.
Then we realized that it was up to us to get the job done. The year was 2008, we decided that we would not tolerate living in a beer desert any more. Prime Microbrewery was conceived.
After going to Hell and back we managed to open our brewery and share our passion for quality beer with the rest of our island. It was a long and hard voyage…

breweries.name: Anacortes Brewery
breweries.description: Our brewers focus on high quality ingredients, a carefully controlled process and delicate handling to provide one of the best beers you will find in the industry. We operate a seven barrel brewery designed and installed by Sound Brewing Systems of Seattle with vessels fabricated by Ripley Stainless in British Columbia. Our brewery features a cold room specially designed for lagering to provide our beers with a traditional character and complexity.
